author: yuppie.eth
content: Next question -- If I'm sitting here mining ETH on my GPU -- Can I use that as my ETH node?

author: yuppie.eth
content: Can I watch the TX pool there?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content:
No, your GPU does not verify the blockchain. It receives work packages from the mining pool which are only hashes of the blocks.
So you don't even know which transactions your mining on. 
You need to setup a geth node to watch the txpool (might be able to run it in `syncmode=light` but I'm not sure about that)

content: I'm trying to decide if I should run my own node (resources required? raspi ok?) or just using CloudFlare's ETH node.

author: mariusvanderwijden
content:
Just looked it up, you have access to the txpool in the lightclient.
So you can start your node with `syncmode=light` which requires ~10 GB and can be run easily on a raspi
